person.persName: Madison Conyers Johnson (Fayette County, KY, attorney, bank director, professor, and chair of Transy U trustees)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, attorney, bank director and university trustee. Fayette County native. Son of Major William Johnson and Elizabeth Payne Johnson. Married to Sallie Ann Clay Johnson on December 23, 1828. Graduated from Transylvania University in 1823. Read law with Martin D. Hardin in Frankfort in 1824. Admitted to the Kentucky bar in 1825. Attorney in Fayette County from 1828 to at least 1865. Member of the Whig party. Owned seven enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1850. Elected to the legislature of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1853 and 1857. Member of the board of directors of the Northern Bank of Kentucky from 1837 and president since 1858. Owned thirteen enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1860. Chairman of the board of trustees of Transylvania University in 1865. President of the law department of Kentucky University in 1865.
